appearances.snippet: one, two there is no and it's interesting that in 2018, ronny jackson, his former personal physician, ct of his of his of his heart. and that suggested that there was some evidence of coronary artery disease. now suddenly he has a ct of his heart, supposedly that suggests that's completely normal. that's unlikely, because as we get cts of our heart, say, of our coronary arteries, so-called coronary calcium scan, which is not uncommon, something that we tend to do. and we would like more people, frankly, to do it after a certain age. it does show calcifications and potentially plaque buildup in our coronary arteries. that's not abnormal, but it should. it's not the case that in 2018, it looked like there was evidence of that. and then somehow seven years later, as he's aged further with a diet filled with hamburgers and fries, that somehow looks completely normal, that doesn't make any sense. and so they're not coming clean yet again on that. and then fundamentally, on the topic of transparency, i and many others just said release the actual results because they don't have a lot of tru

appearances.snippet: there was no abnormality, which actually doesn't correlate with what doctor ronny jackson told the public in 2018 when he disclosed that the president had a similar ct scan that showed the presence of coronary calcium, which is a marker of coronary artery disease. so the, i'm i'm almost less concerned about the actual, cause of the president's bruising. we can talk about that, than i am about why the the white house medical team has felt the need to study him in the last few months. what symptoms? what clinical concerns have prompted this? because the president is right. when you test the president of the united states, it creates a lot of concern, and rightfully so. >> the what the president said about the about aspirin, which has gotten a lot of attention, taking more aspirin than what his doctors are recommending and his rationale for doing so, which is he said, quotote, they say aspirin is good for thinning out the blood, and i don't want thick blood pouring through my heart. i want nice thin blood pouring through my heart. does that make sense? does that make sense? >> that makes no

appearances.title: CNN News Central : CNNW : January 2, 2026 4:00am-5:01am PST
appearances.snippet: on the testing but the president has had a cardiac ct in the past we know this because doctor ronnie jackson in 2018 during the president's first administration stated that the president had this exact test and it showed some coronary calcification, which is an abnormality suggesting perhaps some underlying coronary artery disease. so maybe this is why doctor barbara bella wanted to repeat this test to see if there's been any any change in in those assessments. but again there's there are a lot of questions here, particularly why is the president taking so much aspirin and also why is the president taking aspirin at all yeah i mean, there are questions there, and i think he tried to put it to rest with this, but it actually opened up more questions doctor jonathan reiner, it is always a pleasure to have you here to sort of walk us through this medically. a lot of people, you know, look to the president and may want to sort of start taking his own advice, but he admits that he did not follow his doctor's instructions. so it's a warning for folks and you always help us wade through it. we do a
